thread.title: Arizona Wildcats baseball channels 'Major League' in spot-on video spoof
thread.title_full: Arizona Wildcats baseball channels 'Major League' in spot-on video spoof

author: Jason Foster (jfoster@sportingnews.com)
title: Arizona Wildcats baseball channels 'Major League' in spot-on video spoof
text:
February 15, 2017 11:21am EST February 15, 2017 11:21am EST If you're gonna play baseball where "Major League" was filmed, you might as well take advantage. Arizona Wildcats parody of "Major League" (Courtesy of Wildcats baseball) 
Updated at 11:21 a.m. ET 
Updated at 11:21 a.m. ET 
If you're gonna play baseball where "Major League" was filmed, you might as well take advantage. Well played, Arizona Wildcats. 
MORE: The 15 best baseball movies of all time, ranked 
In a clever promotional video for their 2017 season, the Wildcats channel the cult 1989 baseball film in a near-shot-for-shot remake of the famous spring training arrival scene at Hi Corbett Field, which long-served as the spring training home of the Indians and is now the home of the Wildcats. 
Arizona coach Jay Johnson does his best Lou Brown, freshman outfielder Matt Frazier faithfully(ish) embodies the persona of Willie Mays Hayes, and other players and personnel lend their acting talents to produce a spoof that's pretty much spot on. 
Yes, "Major League" is a movie that keeps on giving. 
But unless you like feeling old, don't think about how none of the Arizona players had been born when the movie came out. Watch This
